CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 23, 1957, pg. 18A, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. John Edward Richardson... Harris photo." Accompanying article reads: "Miss Hughes Wears White Lace for Rites - Miss Jacqueline Delores Hughes, daughter of Mrs. Olivia S. Hughes, was married Sunday evening to John Edward Richardson, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Richardson Sr.  Rev. D. W. Bass performed the ceremony.  The bride was charming in a ballerina-length white cotton lace dress with a fingertip veil.  She carried a bouquet of white rosebuds and camellias.  Miss Constance Lawrence, maid of honor, was lovely in pale yellow and carried pink carnations and tulips.  William Davis was best man.  After a brilliant reception at the Greene Hearthe [Hearth], the couple held open house at their apartment."
TitMainTitle: Groom John Edward Richardson wearing dark suit, and bride Jacqueline Delores Hughes Richardson wearing short sleeved lace wedding dress and sheer fingerless gloves, cutting four tiered wedding cake, in Greene Hearth, vertical format
